N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 186.4 - Notice when debtor's interest not insured

State Regulations

Where a policy provides insurance solely for the interest of the creditor and a licensee of this department has either actual or constructive notice that an identifiable charge for the policy has been made to the debtor: (a) the insurer issuing such policy shall provide notice to the debtor that the debtor's interest is not protected; and
(b) any agent or broker who arranges for or obtains such insurance shall provide that the debtor be clearly advised in writing that such insurance is for the sole protection of the creditor. Such policies also shall provide, except for wilful acts or omissions, an express waiver of subrogation against the debtor, or any assignee of the debtor. Notes
